title: Reduce Report Load Time by Eliminating Redundant Card Merging

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [Slack](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1768476488209959)

### Background:
Currently, personal Expensify cards are stored under ONYXKEYS.CARD_LIST, while workspace-issued cards are stored under ONYXKEYS.COLLECTION.WORKSPACE_CARDS_LIST. Multiple components independently subscribe to both stores and locally merge the two datasets using mergeCardListWithWorkspaceFeeds, often applying slightly different filtering logic. These components mount frequently, while the underlying card data changes relatively infrequently.

### Problem:
When users open reports that contain many personal and workspace cards, then report views take noticeably longer to load, degrading the perceived performance of core reporting workflows.

### Solution:
Introduce a derived Onyx value, ONYXKEYS.DERIVED.NON_PERSONAL_AND_WORKSPACE_CARD_LIST, which depends on CARD_LIST and WORKSPACE_CARDS_LIST. This derived value filters out personal cards and merges both sources once within the Onyx engine, recomputing only when one of the underlying keys changes. Components subscribe to the derived value instead of performing local merges, eliminating redundant per-mount computations.

Results:
On heavy account there is +40k cards in workspace list.

- Open report from Reports Tab, Expenses section. Time reduced from 750ms to 560 ms (25%)
   - Number or mergeCardListWithWorkspaceFeeds calls reduced from 29 to 0
- Restart app (on Reports Tab, Expenses section) Time reduced from 3850 ms to 3630 ms (5,7%)
   - Number or mergeCardListWithWorkspaceFeeds calls reduced from 49 to 9.
- Open report from Reports Tab, Reports section. Time reduced from 775ms to 600 ms (22%)
- Time spent on  useCardFeedsForDisplay reduced from 260ms to 0.1ms (stable derived reference, openReport action)

Even with a few cards, it provides a more stable reference, which should result in fewer rerenders for other components.
Draft PR: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79347
Part of https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/77173 effort

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @situchan</details>

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @LukasMod</details>

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.2-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2966/folder/13177085/41237993/1125947174 **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Win 11/Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com login with new account 2. Create a workspace 3. Navigate to workspace chat and click Create expense 4. Try to drag an image file from your local machine and drop it to upload receipt zone 5. Close RHP and click on Create expense 6. Drag an image file and drop it to upload receipt zone ## Expected Result: At step 4, user can drop image file to the upload receipt zone ## Actual Result: At step 4, red circle with a cross appearing, user can't drop image file to upload receipt zone. Close RHP and create expense again, user can drop it to upload receipt zone. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7721dd0c-746c-4208-97b7-a0c0eff760c3 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Make it easier to change a business bank account linked to the workspace

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.0-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** No **Issue reported by:** @VictoriaExpensify (CC: @joekaufmanexpensify @dannymcclain @sonialiap) **Slack conversation**: [#migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1768357181473589) ## Action Performed: 1. Add two business bank accounts to your account 2. Connect one to the workspace successfully 3. Go to Workflows > Make or track payments > click on the bank account ## Expected Result: _This is an improvement._ 1. When an admin of a workspace clicks on the bank account in Workflows show this screen: 2. When they click `Change bank account` navigate them to this existing screen if they have other bank accounts they can add instead: 3. Else, this existing screen if they don't have an existing bank account: ## Actual Result: Today, the only option you see is to `Disconnect bank account`, so it's unclear that you need to do that first to see your other business bank accounts to change over to. ## Workaround: Disconnect first, then add another existing bank account. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above.
